{"id":1284122813,"question_id":2,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 year, 1 month","timestamp":1718043444,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"11 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1284122813/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"76.1 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\n\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        // Dummy head to simplify result list creation\n        ListNode* dummyHead = new ListNode(0);\n        ListNode* current = dummyHead;\n        int carry = 0;\n        \n        // Traverse both linked lists\n        while (l1 != nullptr || l2 != nullptr) {\n            int x = (l1 != nullptr) ? l1->val : 0;\n            int y = (l2 != nullptr) ? l2->val : 0;\n            \n            // Calculate sum and carry\n            int sum = carry + x + y;\n            carry = sum / 10;\n            current->next = new ListNode(sum % 10);\n            \n            // Move to the next nodes\n            current = current->next;\n            if (l1 != nullptr) l1 = l1->next;\n            if (l2 != nullptr) l2 = l2->next;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if there's any carry left\n        if (carry > 0) {\n            current->next = new ListNode(carry);\n        }\n        \n        return dummyHead->next;\n    }\n};\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1,"frontend_id":54}
